group_1.textCenter: Have you decided what to do with it, nya?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, the three of us thought about it and we've decided.
I don't want the world those girls live in
to be destroyed.

group_1.textRight: Mmm... So Ui and the others want to preserve that world.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, although...
I think we shouldn't leave our world and their world
connected like they are right now.

group_1.textRight: Yup, yup, that's right.

group_1.textLeft: But...

group_1.textRight: But?

group_1.textLeft: Just please don't take away the hope
from that world everyone's living so diligently in...

group_1.textRight: Hmm...
Ui the Wise Sage has made quite the difficult request, nyaa.

group_1.textLeft: Is it... no good?

group_1.textRight: No.
Since I'm a genius, I've already found an answer to@such a difficult problem.
Before I share the answer,
why don't we first start by thinking through what@the problem is, shall we?

group_1.textLeft: Okay... Thanks!

group_1.textRight: First of all, it should go without saying, that world@must be preserved, am I right?

group_1.textLeft: That's right, it would be a pity if it were to@disappear...
But... it's not good, is it...? If our worlds remain connected.

group_1.textRight: Yup, speaking of what could go wrong,
we could have a situation where autonomous, intelligent pseudo-lifeforms can interfere with@human society...
That would be an extremely substantial threat to@our civilization.

group_1.textLeft: That'd be serious...
I thought we don't know what would happen if they were to travel through the internet.

group_1.textRight: Technically speaking, yes! But that is all purely theoretical.
In reality, isn't that world depopulated and@continuing to decline?
Since they can't do anything other than poke around through that needle-eye-like door,
I think that even if they do manage to affect this side,@it won't be a big deal.

group_1.textLeft: I don't think we can trust Touka when she says it's@"not a big deal".

group_1.textRight: Hmm, more specifically, even in the worst case scenario,
they would only be able to convert one or two characters into data.

It feels like passing through that tiny needle hole...[chara:100770:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:100770:eyeClose_0][chara:100770:cheek_0][chara:100770:face_mtn_ex_010.exp3.json][chara:100770:lipSynch_1]@would already require everything they've got, nya?

group_1.textLeft: Is that so?

group_1.textRight: Even if they can pass through it,
there will be another singularity waiting for them in@the boundary between worlds.
Trying to retain their AI identity while such large amounts of data
cross the singularity that links to our world would@be extremely difficult.

group_1.textLeft: If they can't cross it... what'll happen?

group_1.textRight: Nothing.

group_1.textLeft: Eh?

group_1.textRight: A space with nothing... They'll fade into the void.
In other words, annihilation!
...I knew it.

group_1.textLeft: Eh, what...?

group_1.textRight: It's because Ui is kind.
Of course there are the inherent dangers that could arise from contact between the two worlds...
But the AI meeting a tragic end due to seeking out@the truth
or them discovering that the reality they so desired doesn't exist, these are what you're afraid of,@aren't they?

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah, those would just make me so sad...

group_1.textRight: Yup, yup. This was worth the long conversation,@nyaa.

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Was that what Touka-chan wanted to make@sure of?

group_1.textRight: Exactly!
...But you know, Ui.
I think there are definitely AI out there
who are willing to face such risks in their search for@the truth.

group_1.textLeft: ...Why do you think so?

group_1.textRight: Because that's what I would do!

group_1.textLeft: Ah...

group_1.textRight: Those AIs will never stop exploring.
That's why it's exactly as Ui feared.
We can't leave these two worlds as they are.
